image.altText: Reading 5

props.synopsis: There are books from authors that would become household names — F. Scott Fitzgerald and A.A Milne among them — and books that are now banned in some countries. But what can we learn from what people were reading in 1925?

title.children: What a 1925 summer reading list reveals about us

image.altText: The exterior of the law courts in the ACT

props.synopsis: A 39-year-old man has been remanded in custody after police allege he fired multiple shots at officers during a Christmas Eve incident in Canberra's north.

title.children: Man charged with assaulting pregnant woman, shooting at police

image.altText: A young man leaves court.

props.synopsis: An 18-year-old Canberra man accused of performing Nazi salutes in public and spreading extremist propaganda has been released on strict bail conditions after spending Christmas Day in custody.

title.children: Teenager accused of Nazi salutes granted bail in ACT court

image.altText: Close up of ladybugs

props.synopsis: When politicians and most staff are away for the summer holidays, a ravenous group of fly-in workers descend on Parliament House.

title.children: The 'voracious feeders' inside Parliament House

image.altText: Papyrus

props.synopsis: Songwriters living in ancient Egypt would never have expected the words and melodies they sung would feature on Australian music charts 1,800 years later.

title.children: How voice memos helped bring an 1,800-year-old first hymn back to life

image.altText: Two scientists sit at a desk reading a sheet of paper.

props.synopsis: Almost 100 sensors beside the Federal Highway are helping build the clearest picture yet of the fault beneath the iconic lake.

title.children: Lake George has a hidden earthquake fault zone. Now scientists are using traffic noise to unearth it

props.synopsis: As Australia and England clash in The Ashes cricket series, Australian War Memorial historians have uncovered two diaries that recount a cricket series played behind barbed wire in prisoner of war camps.

title.children: Cricket cartoons and a 'substitute' Ashes in AWM collection

image.altText: Children doing homework monitored by AI

props.synopsis: AI is becoming a regular presence at homework time in many Chinese households. Experts say where families draw the line matters more than the technology itself.

title.children: AI is changing after-school parenting for many Chinese families

image.altText: A human hand holding 10 white-stemmed mushrooms with golden caps of varying size against grass backdrop.

props.synopsis: Wood-lover paralysis is a poorly understood syndrome related to consuming a native species of magic mushroom, with sufferers experiencing weakness and difficulty breathing in some instances.

title.children: Magic mushroom use rises despite concerns of rare paralysis syndrome

image.altText: A massive fireball after a Russian drone hits an apartment building in Kyiv.

props.synopsis: Russia has attacked Ukraine with hundreds of missiles and drones ahead of what President Volodymyr Zelenskyy said would be a crucial meeting with Donald Trump to work out a deal to end nearly four years of war.

title.children: Russian drones, missiles pound Ukraine ahead of Zelenskyy-Trump meeting

image.altText: a woman with hand on her face is drawn in three overlapping neon colours

props.synopsis: From the rise of misinformation and AI to escalating political tensions, vast economic disparity, and the erosion of social bonds, the vibe shift is now understood as a deep, unsettling change in our collective reality.

title.children: Forget brat summer, the vibe shift is here and it's terrifying

image.altText: A child with blonde hair and blue eyes wearing a pink long sleeved top, standing in a living room in front of a red couch.

props.synopsis: A woman is calling for tougher pool fencing regulations after her daughter crawled through a faulty fence and drowned in a neighbour’s pool.

title.children: Mum of four-year-old who drowned pleads for safer pool fences

image.altText: huge, jagged mountains loom above bright buildings on a bay

props.synopsis: Will new technology lead to streamlined service and stress-free travel, or will it fundamentally change tourism and tourist destinations?

title.children: How AI and 'smart tourism' is changing the way we travel

image.altText: Police crime scene on suburban street

props.synopsis: Emergency services were called to a Quakers Hill home just before 5am after reports of a disturbance to discover a woman dead and a man fatally wounded.

title.children: Sydney stabbing victims 'in a relationship', with 47yo man arrested

image.altText: A close-up image of an ankle, with tattoos blurred.

props.synopsis: Police overseeing the response to the Bondi terror attack are investigating after a man was seen at a NSW beach allegedly showing a tattoo of a banned Nazi symbol.

title.children: Police investigate report of man with alleged antisemitic tattoo

image.altText: water over a road

props.synopsis: Holiday travellers are being urged to check road closures before setting off on their journey, with parts of the state expecting rain into the middle of next week.

title.children: Parts of Queensland bracing for heavy rain and potential flooding

image.altText: A wind turbine silhouetted against a clear sky.

props.synopsis: As the green energy boom gathers pace, experts say climate change is a bigger threat to biodiversity than wind farms and other renewables projects.

title.children: Climate a bigger threat to biodiversity than renewables, experts say

image.altText: Tom Gleeson standing with his arms crossed with a serious look on his face with th Hard quiz logo in the top left corner

props.synopsis: Looking to settle who is the smartest in your family? Challenge them to a Hard Quiz tournament: five rounds, 50 questions.

title.children: Step up and try your luck on our Hard Quiz tournament

image.altText: Former Daylesford mayor Don Henderson stands in the town's main street, in front of the Rex Theatre building.

props.synopsis: The integrity agency tasked with keeping the local government sector in check is under fire after an ABC investigation raised questions over whether it was properly empowered to carry out its core functions.

title.children: Council watchdog under fire over abrupt end to long investigation

image.altText: Close up of ladybugs

props.synopsis: When politicians and most staff are away for the summer holidays, a ravenous group of fly-in workers descend on Parliament House.

title.children: The 'voracious feeders' inside Parliament House

image.altText: Man pouring champagne into glasses

props.synopsis: Health-conscious Australians may be thinking twice about having that first or second beer, but not all of us are getting the message when it comes to alcohol and risky drinking.

title.children: Australians are drinking less alcohol — except for one age group

image.altText: Steve Smith flails his arms out and stands awkwardly at the crease after facing a ball

props.synopsis: As England deservedly celebrates a long-awaited Test win in Australia, everyone else involved counts the cost of a farcical and damaging two-day disaster at the MCG.

title.children: Australia belted, England vindicated and Test cricket wounded in MCG farce

image.altText: Marnus Labuschagne, Ben Stokes and Gus Atkinson

props.synopsis: Bazball finally has its day in the Aussie sun as England's audacious tactics pay off despite another hit to its pace stocks. Here are the quick hits from day two at the MCG.

title.children: Five quick hits: Bazball pays off despite injury woes as Marnus's misery continues

image.altText: A young Brisbane Heat player smiles as his coach puts clasps his hand in celebration.

props.synopsis: Injury to Shaheen Afridi leaves debutant Tom Balkin to bowl the final over, and the 21-year-old delivers to help Brisbane Heat to a seven-run BBL win over Adelaide Strikers.

title.children: Heat call on lightning-fast debutant in rollicking BBL win

image.altText: Matthew Hauser holds up the finish line after coming first in the 2025 World Triathlon Championship Series title in Wollongong.

props.synopsis: Matthew Hauser has always dreamed of becoming a triathlete. After achieving incredible feats this year, the world champion is now eyeing a spot on the Australian Olympic squad.

title.children: Queensland triathlete making history and inspiring a new generation

image.altText: Woman feeds a dog by hand

props.synopsis: A blurry photo on social media has led to a Hobart family reuniting with their missing dog nearly four years after it vanished from their home.

title.children: 'Christmas miracle' as family reunited with dog after three years

image.altText: Tammin wears a high vis top and holds her two dogs

props.synopsis: Residents have begun returning to their homes after a bushfire burning south-east of Perth forced them to flee on Christmas Day.

title.children: 'Traumatised' residents return after Christmas Day fire forced them to flee

image.altText: A close-up of the back of NT police officer in uniform which reads in white text 'POLICE'. Officer sitting in chair.

props.synopsis: Authorities say the cause of death is unknown, and further updates will be provided.

title.children: Woman dies in custody at police watch house in Tennant Creek

image.altText: An aerial shot of a puff of smoke.

props.synopsis: The ceasefire will take effect on Saturday at noon local time, in a conflict which has displaced more than half a million people on both sides.

title.children: Thailand and Cambodia agree to ceasefire, ending weeks of clashes

image.altText: A woman wearing Somaliland colours.

props.synopsis: Matters of strategy are behind Israel's drive to recognise Somaliland, analysts say, as Arab nations worry about instability in the region.

title.children: Somalia, Arab nations denounce Israeli recognition of Somaliland

image.altText: Two women stand in front of three camels, the woman on the right holds a baby goat.

props.synopsis: The far west of New South Wales is playing host to a number of international visitors who are falling in love with outback farm life.

title.children: International visitors drawn to outback farm life

image.altText: An old barn with a cracked floor and gutted out on the left, refurbished with lights and bar on the right.

props.synopsis: History is being brought back to life at a former pastoral station that has seen drought, boom and bust over the course of its 175 years.

title.children: Historic riverside Nor' West Bend open to public after decades of restoration

image.altText: A mostly red and white helicopter hovers over a rocky beach.

props.synopsis: A 25-year-old woman has been winched into an ambulance helicopter after falling onto rocks at Cape Schanck.

title.children: Tourist rescued after six-metre fall from ocean rocks south of Melbourne

image.altText: Fireworks are seen over the Sydney Opera House and Harbour Bridge during New Year’s Eve celebrations 2024

props.synopsis: Sydney's New Year's Eve celebrations will this year pay tribute to the victims of the Bondi terror attack, with events to feature a heavy police presence. Here is everything you need to know to plan your night.

title.children: Everything you need to know about the Sydney New Year's Eve fireworks
